channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Deadly storms devastate parts of the U.S. South and Midwest
item.description: The National Weather Service has issued a warning that the South and Midwest may experience more severe storms, flooding and tornadoes in the days ahead.
item.content:encoded:
The National Weather Service has issued a warning that the South and Midwest may experience more severe storms, flooding and tornadoes in the days ahead.

(Image credit: Jon Cherry/AP)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: How will the deep cuts at the Centers for Disease Control affect global programs?
item.description: The U.S. agency has not released information on what global programs were cut this week. NPR spoke to current employees who provided exclusive details.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. agency has not released information on what global programs were cut this week. NPR spoke to current employees who provided exclusive details.

(Image credit: Elijah Nouvelage)
item.dc:creator: Fatma Tanis

item.title: Paige Bueckers' moment
item.description: The University of Connecticut's women's basketball team is back in the Final Four thanks in part to Paige Bueckers. Bueckers has done a lot in her amazing career except win the NCAA title. She's ready.
item.content:encoded: The University of Connecticut's women's basketball team is back in the Final Four thanks in part to Paige Bueckers. Bueckers has done a lot in her amazing career except win the NCAA title. She's ready.
item.dc:creator: Steve Futterman

item.title: Supreme Court sides with administration over Education Department grants
item.description: By a 5-4 vote, the justices allowed the administration to freeze millions of dollars in grant funding for diversity and instructional programs at public and private universities.
item.content:encoded:
By a 5-4 vote, the justices allowed the administration to freeze millions of dollars in grant funding for diversity and instructional programs at public and private universities.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Judge orders the Trump administration to return man who was mistakenly deported
item.description: A federal judge in Maryland Friday ordered the Trump administration to take immediate steps to return a Maryland man who was deported to a Salvadoran mega-prison by mistake, setting up another high-stakes clash between the White House and the courts.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge in Maryland Friday ordered the Trump administration to take immediate steps to return a Maryland man who was deported to a Salvadoran mega-prison by mistake, setting up another high-stakes clash between the White House and the courts.

(Image credit: Jose Luis Magana)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: He's a decorated war vet but a convicted criminal. ICE wants to deport him
item.description: Jose Barco's story is one of battlefield trauma, bureaucratic bumbling and eventually, a serious crime.
item.content:encoded:
Jose Barco's story is one of battlefield trauma, bureaucratic bumbling and eventually, a serious crime.

(Image credit: Tia Barco)
item.dc:creator: Tom Bowman

item.title: The Opaque War Against the Houthis in Yemen
item.description: We heard a lot about the planning by U.S. national security officials for a bombing campaign against Houthi fighters in Yemen, because a journalist was added to their Signal group chat. That bombing campaign is ongoing and we haven't heard much about how it is going or its goals. Our national security correspondent tells us about what the U.S. military is doing in Yemen and how we're getting more information about that from the Houthis than from the Pentagon.
item.content:encoded: We heard a lot about the planning by U.S. national security officials for a bombing campaign against Houthi fighters in Yemen, because a journalist was added to their Signal group chat. That bombing campaign is ongoing and we haven't heard much about how it is going or its goals. Our national security correspondent tells us about what the U.S. military is doing in Yemen and how we're getting more information about that from the Houthis than from the Pentagon.

item.title: Trump extends TikTok's sell-by deadline again
item.description: On his first day in office, President Trump used an executive order to hit pause on the TikTok ban for 75 days. Now he's pushing back that deadline.
item.content:encoded:
On his first day in office, President Trump used an executive order to hit pause on the TikTok ban for 75 days. Now he's pushing back that deadline.

(Image credit: Matt Slocum)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Popular brands of liquid eggs are recalled over bleach contamination concerns
item.description: Over 200,000 pounds of Egg Beaters and Bob Evans products were recalled over potential cleaning solution contamination. The USDA says that health risks are low, but consumers should still steer clear.
item.content:encoded: Over 200,000 pounds of Egg Beaters and Bob Evans products were recalled over potential cleaning solution contamination. The USDA says that health risks are low, but consumers should still steer clear.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Higher prices are likely for these 10 grocery items when tariffs hit
item.description: A trip to the grocery or liquor store is about to become even more expensive, economists say. From seafood to olive oil, these items will likely cost more under President Trump's tariffs.
item.content:encoded:
A trip to the grocery or liquor store is about to become even more expensive, economists say. From seafood to olive oil, these items will likely cost more under President Trump's tariffs.

(Image credit: Goh Chai Hin)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman
